title: Accountant
job_overview:
The Accountant plays a vital role in maintaining accurate financial records, supporting account reconciliations, and collaborating with the AP/AR team to ensure smooth day-to-day financial operations. This role requires strong attention to detail, excellent analytical skills, and the ability to work both independently and cross-functionally. Ideal candidates will have experience in eCommerce accounting environments, strong familiarity with US GAAP, and a proven ability to manage financial statements, balance sheets, journal entries, audits, and tax compliance.

Note: This is a passive sourcing opportunity, and while we are always looking to connect with exceptional talent, it may take some time to find the right match for this role.

Responsibilities:

Prepare accurate balance sheets, income statements, and other financial statements in accordance with US GAAP.
Perform account reconciliations, maintain journal entries, and support month-end and year-end close processes.
Collaborate with AP/AR teams to ensure accurate and timely transaction processing.
Assist in preparing schedules and supporting documentation for audits and tax filings.
Partner cross-functionally to identify and implement process improvements across accounting workflows.
Ensure compliance with accounting standards, internal policies, and applicable tax regulations.
Provide financial analysis and assist in budgeting, forecasting, and variance reporting.
Support audit readiness and liaise with external auditors or tax advisors as needed.

Requirements:

Bachelorâ€™s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
CPA designation is a plus.
5+ years of experience in accounting roles, preferably within an eCommerce or consumer-facing environment.
Proficiency in accounting platforms such as Upgrade to see actual info, NetSuite, QuickBooks Online, or Sage Intacct.
Strong working knowledge of US GAAP, financial reporting, and general ledger best practices.
Hands-on experience preparing and reviewing journal entries, balance sheets, and financial statements.
Familiarity with audit processes and tax compliance is required.
Excellent analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work independently while collaborating effectively with a team.
Prior experience supervising AP/AR or junior accounting staff is a plus.

This role is part of our passive recruitment efforts, and while an immediate opening may not be available, we welcome experienced and motivated candidates to express their interest. We look forward to connecting with you should a suitable opportunity arise.
